III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff and youth engaged in a fight. Youth had a mark on his
shoulder and under his eye.
Investigation On 7/12/24 Complainant reported that on 7/11/24 Youth A and
Staff 1 were playing around. Youth A became mad and he fought
with Staff 1. Youth A had a mark on his shoulder that may be from
fingers and a mark under his eye. Complainant was contacted on
7/15/24 and indicated they did not have any further information, as
they did not witness the alleged incident.
On 7/15/24 Chief Administrator was interviewed at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief Administrator reported
they were unaware of any incidents with Youth A or Staff 1 on
7/11/24 or any other time. Chief Administrator identified the other
youth that would have been present on the unit on 7/11/24. Chief
Administrator did not have video available as the facility was in the
process of having new cameras installed on the day of the alleged
incident. Follow-up occurred on 7/18/24 and 8/9/24, at which time
the Chief Administrator confirmed no video was recorded on
7/11/24.
On 7/15/24 Youth A was interviewed at the facility in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Youth A stated he did not recall any
incidents with Staff 1. Youth A did not express any concerns about
Staff 1. Youth A did not wish to be interviewed further. No marks
were visible on Youth A.
A follow-up interview was completed by DCWL with Youth A on
8/19/24. Youth A stated he never saw staff “put their hands” on
any youth at the facility, including himself. Youth A stated staff
never threatened him or hurt him.
2

On 7/15/24 an interview was attempted with Youth B at the
facility. However, he refused to speak to DCWL or MDHHS
Worker.
On 7/15/24 Youth C was interviewed at the facility in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he did not see any
altercations between Youth A and staff. Youth C did not report any
concerns about any staff.
On 7/15/24 an interview was attempted with Youth D at the
facility. However, he refused to speak to DCWL or MDHHS
Worker.
On 7/15/24 Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated he worked on the unit on
7/11/24. Staff 2 did not recall seeing any physical incidents
between youth or staff. Staff 2 did not have any concerns
regarding how Staff 1 interacted with youth.
On 8/9/24 Supervisor was interviewed on site in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported she did not recall
hearing or seeing any physical altercations with Youth A, or any
staff on 7/11/24. Supervisor stated that Youth A generally does
not rough house or fight. Supervisor did not have any concerns
about how Staff 1 interacted with youth.
On 8/9/24 Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she did not witness any
altercations involving Youth A on 7/11/24. Staff 3 stated it would
be out of character for Youth A to physically fight with staff. Staff 3
did not have any concerns about how Staff 1 interacted with
youth.
On 8/9/24 Staff 4 was interviewed at the facility, in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 stated he did not recall any incidents
between Youth A and staff on 7/11/24. Staff 4 did not have any
concerns about how Staff 1 interacted with youth.
On 9/4/24 Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility. Staff 1 stated he
never had an altercation with Youth A. Staff 1 denied ever
engaging in rough housing or horse play with Youth A. Staff 1
stated he was not aware of any marks on Youth A and denied
causing any marks.
3

Analysis The facility is found to be in compliance as interviews with youth
and staff indicated there was not an altercation between Staff 1
and Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
